0: Buy Photo File Photo (Photo: THE NEWS-STAR / THE NEWS-STAR)Buy Photo NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Fourth Judicial District Attorney Jerry Jones will dismiss the ticket issued to the Texas teenage driver whose family was killed in a tragic accident Wednesday night. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR The 16-year-old was driving a Chevrolet Tahoe on I-20 near Calhoun when he admits he fell asleep and lost control of the vehicle. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Police say the vehicle hit the median, the driver over corrected causing the vehicle to flip, ejecting six of its occupants. Five of those ejected were pronounced dead on the scene. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR "This young man has been punished enough," Jones said. "There is no need to add to his pain. The ticket will be dismissed." NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR The family of eight people were a blended family traveling to Disney World for a Thanksgiving vacation. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Two adults, Michael and Trudi Hardman of Terrell, Texas, and three children, Dakota Watson, 15, Kaci Hardman, 4, and Adam Hardman, 7. were killed. The wreck happened about 10:30 p.m. Wednesday. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Louisiana State Police issued the driver a citation for careless operation in accordance with policy. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR No further citations or charges will be
